intro: Lechea virgata var. breviflora, commonly known as the short-flowered lechea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. This species is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
